questions.question: He is …………………..
questions.description: Died is the past tense of die. Dead is an adjective.

questions.question: The injured man had …………………….. by the time they took him to hospital.
questions.description: Died is the past participle of die.

questions.question: She ……………………… acting at the age of five.
questions.description: The simple past is used when we say when something happened.

questions.question: We spent hours ……………………… music and movies.
questions.description: Discuss is one of those verbs that are not followed by a preposition.

questions.question: I have ……………………. for the drinks.
questions.description: Paid is the past participle of pay.

questions.question: There are some advantages ……………………….. alone.
questions.description: When the clause begins with there are, write advantages + to + ing form/noun.

questions.question: It is high time you …………………….. a job.
questions.description: Use a simple past after it is time/it is high time.

questions.question: What a brilliant idea ………………………..!
questions.description: The inverted word order is used in exclamations.

questions.question: I asked him why ………………………… crying.
questions.description: The inverted word order is used in indirect questions.

questions.question: You had better …………………………. for that job.
questions.description: Had better is used to give strong advice or warnings. Infinitive without to is used after had better.

questions.question: If she found out, we …………………………. in trouble.
questions.description: In the second conditional, we use a simple past tense in the if-clause and would + first form of the verb in the main clause.

questions.question: If you do not leave at once, I ……………………….. the police.
questions.description: In the first conditional, we use a simple present tense in the if-clause and will + infinitive in the main clause.
